abstract: Spain’s second-largest bank will depend on North America for 10 percent of its earnings after it completes the purchase of 622 new U.S. branches.
snippet: Spain’s second-largest bank will depend on North America for 10 percent of its earnings after it completes the purchase of 622 new U.S. branches.
lead_paragraph: LONDON, Feb. 16 — Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria, Spain’s second-largest bank, after Santander, agreed to buy Compass Bancshares of the United States for $9.6 billion, making its biggest acquisition abroad in a market where it seeks to strengthen its foothold.

headline.main: Banco Bilbao to Expand U.S. Presence by Buying Compass Bancshares
headline.print_headline: Spanish Bank to Acquire Compass of U.S.
